channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The ASX is set to dip as Wall Street turned lower after a bright start to the session.
item.title: ASX set to slide lower as Wall Street fades

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Cricket NSW and Queensland Cricket will agitate against the re-appointment of Cricket Australia chairman Earl Eddings at the upcoming AGM.
item.title: Watch out Earl Eddings, a civil war is playing out between Cricket Australia and the states

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The world’s largest investor, BlackRock, has played down concerns about the potential power of massive shareholders to weaken competition between rival listed firms.
item.title: ‘Not decisive’: US giant BlackRock plays down its voting power on ASX

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: A parliamentary inquiry has revealed an EISS director was investigated for sharing confidential board documents with the Electrical Trades Union, adding to the super fund’s mounting governance headaches.
item.title: EISS director probed for sharing confidential documents with union

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Three years after Australian racing’s cult hero famously refused to run, is it right to claim Masked Crusader is following the same path as Chautauqua?
item.title: ‘He thinks he’s another Chautauqua’: How Masked Crusader is mimicking the ‘Grey Flash’

item.dc:creator: Nick McKenzie
item.description: The boss of iProsperity, Michael Gu, whose company collapsed owing $325 million, is accused of laundering millions through Crown and Star casinos - and offered a job to a man who was a manager at both.
item.title: Star’s high-roller manager was close to accused corporate crook, now fugitive

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce has added $100 million to a $200 million grants program that has disproportionately gone to projects in Coalition seats.
item.title: ‘I don’t care what they call it’: Joyce will push on with regional cash splashes

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The financial crime prevention start-up, which counts three of the four major banks and Afterpay as customers, has just opened an office in Seattle and has its eyes set on London and Singapore.
item.title: Financial crime fighter FrankieOne plots global expansion after funding win

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: Beijing regarded Australia as something of a nuisance, but it is becoming a leader among nations coalescing against China’s threats.
item.title: How Australia has shaped up to Xi’s aggression

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Featureless glass towers, blank car parks at street level and poor-quality developments will be targeted by a group of experts appointed to safeguard Melbourne’s architectural integrity.
item.title: Design panels to tackle Melbourne’s ‘crap’ buildings

item.description: As the NSW Parliament prepares to debate voluntary assisted dying laws, progressive MPs need to consider quantum advances in palliative care already available, but which only the wealthy can afford.
item.title: Average citizens might not ‘volunteer’ for death if they could afford what the rich can: staying alive with dignity

item.description: Researchers estimate the facility, which dates back some 1500 years, could produce about 2 million litres of wine a year.
item.title: Israeli archaeologists discover ancient winemaking complex

item.description: British police have announced they will not take any action against Prince Andrew after a review prompted by a Jeffrey Epstein accuser who claims that he sexually assaulted her.
item.title: UK police won’t act against Prince Andrew over abuse claim

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Scientists used low-frequency radio waves to detect distant red dwarf stars giving off a unique pattern that suggested a planet orbiting them.
item.title: Distant planets could be source of radio waves and scientists are tuning in

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The future king said it would be a “disaster” if next month’s COP26 summit collapsed, and appeared taken aback when told Morrison still did not know whether he would go.
item.title: Prince Charles urges Scott Morrison to attend climate summit to help avoid global ‘catastrophe’

item.description: Since 2000, more than 7.2 million hectares of threatened species habitat, mainly for farming. But farmers are now looking for compensation for the land they have not cleared.
item.title: Farmers invite opprobrium with ‘Kyoto’ compensation demands

item.dc:creator: Amelia McGuire
item.description: The Australian aviation sector could soon be welcoming a new entrant as independent carrier, Bonza, gets ready to offer more options to budget-conscious travellers.
item.title: ‘Tradies, teachers, kids and carers’: New airline Bonza targets budget flights

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: Hawke to US: hands off, Joh faces sack: Sparkes, and go eat an ashtray
item.title: In the Herald: October 12, 1987

item.description: Fifty years ago, “pretty little blue-eyed blonde” Jacki Weaver was preparing for her newest role - as a grunting, tuba-playing grandmother.
item.title: From the Archives, 1971: Miss Krinkles is busy

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Golf has had a surprisingly good pandemic, but now is looking to outside the ropes to guarantee its future.
item.title: Mini-golf to the max: old game in the rough but simulators and putt-putt are in

item.dc:creator: Sean Parnell
item.description: Two people in an ambulance have died after the vehicle was hit by a truck and forced off the road at Stanwell, west of Rockhampton in central Queensland.
item.title: Two dead, multiple people injured after crash on Capricornia Highway

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Educating parents on signs and symptoms of mental distress is just one of the recommendations from the new strategy to tackle mental health in under-12s.
item.title: Keeping kids well the focus of new national mental health strategy

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Victorian government is set to impose a six-day quarantine period on jockeys entering the state, meaning Sydney hoops will have to pick either the $7.5m Rosehill race or the staying classic at Flemington.
item.title: NSW jockeys forced to choose between Golden Eagle and Melbourne Cup

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today’s interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and Superquiz, Tuesday, October 12

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: We should give the Morrison government credit where it’s due - because it will be a dangerous legacy if politicians think twice about unleashing stimulus in our next economic crisis.
item.title: It’s OK to bury JobKeeper ... and to praise it

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: The prize is the last awarded of this year’s crop.
item.title: ‘Abolutely stunned’: Three share 2021 Nobel prize in economics

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, October 12, 2021

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: A dominant year in which the mare won five group 1 races from 1400m to 2400m saw her named Australian racehorse of the year on Monday.
item.title: Verry Elleegant wins Australian racehorse of the year

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, October 11, 2021

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Details have emerged of the efforts Queensland authorities took in the early days of the blaze, eventually burning more than half the World Heritage-listed site (formerly Fraser Island).
item.title: Parks executive cited ‘unwarranted pressure’ in early K’gari burn halt

item.dc:creator: Cloe Read
item.description: Several submissions to the Women’s Safety and Justice Taskforce have detailed how the police response was failing female victims of violence, including one instance where police informed a victim that because she was wearing a G-string she would ‘lose her case’.”
item.title: ‘Police asked her what sort of underwear she was wearing’

item.description: Where to line up for Melange.
item.title: A vaccine clinic far far away

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: WA Police said the boy had been on the water with his family when he became involved in a “boating incident” but there was little detail about what happened.
item.title: Missing boy involved in ‘boating incident’ near Walpole, police say

item.description: The findings are a boost to the British drug maker’s efforts to develop coronavirus medicines beyond vaccines.
item.title: AstraZeneca antibody cocktail succeeds in late-stage study to treat COVID-19, company says

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: A group of lawyers who claimed $19 million in fees and commissions from elderly investors in a civil action against a collapsed financial lender have been referred to Victoria’s public prosecutor to investigate possible criminal offending.
item.title: Judge lashes lawyers in Banksia Securities case, refers conduct to prosecutors

item.dc:creator: Daniella White
item.description: Police have confirmed the remains found near Moree last week are that of a missing man who was last seen entering the Gwydir River three months ago.
item.title: Human remains identified as missing Aboriginal man

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: The Independent Broad-based Anti-corruption Commission grilled Anthony Byrne on the first day of public hearings probing the misuse of taxpayer-funded staff and grants in which the veteran Labor MP admitted his own involvement in branch stacking and paying for memberships
item.title: Andrews loses fourth minister to branch stacking scandal

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Rohan Browning emerged from two weeks in hotel quarantine to smoke The Everest hope Lost And Running in a curtain raiser to Saturday’s $15m sprint.
item.title: ‘We underestimated how good he is’: Man beats horse in Everest warm-up

item.dc:creator: Cloe Read
item.description: Gamal Elsaied Elboushi smuggled a knife and fake bomb into the airport inside his suitcase before chasing his wife and children through the terminal in 2019.
item.title: Bomb hoax: Man who shut down Brisbane Airport has sentence reduced

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Just four hours into the first day of five weeks of hearings, Luke Donnellan phoned the Premier to resign from cabinet following allegations he contributed to a branch-staking “kitty”.
item.title: Ministerial scalp won’t stop Andrews’ IBAC headache

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The average of 38 days between first and second doses in NSW suggests the state will hit 80 per cent next week, with a change in restrictions the following Monday.
item.title: Next ‘freedom day’ set for October 25 as NSW double-dose rate hits 74 per cent

item.dc:creator: Catherine Bennett
item.description: The population level protection from vaccine coverage will be at its peak right now.
item.title: Good reasons to believe COVID cases may not skyrocket as NSW opens up

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: A parliamentary inquiry was told that some buyers of units off the plan in the 22-storey towers can no longer get loans from major banks.
item.title: ‘No trust’: Buyers of defective units in Parramatta vent their anger

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: An expert in data security says Victoria’s vaccine passport system is too easy to forge, as bar and restaurant owners brace for confrontations with customers when the system opens in Melbourne.
item.title: Vaccine passport too easy to forge, says academic, as bar operators brace for conflict

item.description: Michael Gleeson and Daniel Cherny discuss the latest trade period news, including where things stand in any potential move for GWS’ Bobby Hill.
item.title: ‘The ducks have not all been in a row’

item.dc:creator: Harriet Alexander
item.description: The widow of a personal development group leader Ken Dyers has been accused of grooming young girls for him to sexually abuse.
item.title: ‘Cult’ leader’s widow accused of grooming girls for sexual abuse

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: The AFL is investigating claims former player agent Ricky Nixon allegedly sold forged memorabilia commemorating Melbourne’s breakthrough premiership.
item.title: AFL investigates Nixon for allegedly selling forged Demons premiership memorabilia
